data.title: Champions League final 2024: where is Wembley Stadium, why is it so famous and what is its capacity?
data.meta_description: On Saturday, the eyes of the soccer faithful will turn to London, as the 2024 Champions League final is played on hallowed ground.
data.text:
On Saturday, the eyes of the soccer faithful will turn to London, as the 2024 Champions League final is played on hallowed ground. One of the most prestigious events in global soccer will crown a champion for the home continent of the game, inside the home stadium of the game’s creator.

Located in the borough of Brent in north-west London, Wembley is not just a venue; it is a symbol of soccer heritage and a testament to the sport’s storied history.

Wembley Stadium, revered as “the Cathedral of Football,” stands on the site of the original stadium that opened in 1923. The current structure, inaugurated in 2007 after an extensive rebuild, retains the grandeur and aura of its predecessor while incorporating state-of-the-art facilities. Its iconic arch, towering 134 meters above the ground, has become a defining feature of London’s skyline, visible from various points in the city and symbolizing the modern era of football.

The fame of Wembley Stadium is deeply rooted in its rich history of hosting landmark events. It has been the stage for numerous memorable moments in sports, including the 1966 World Cup final, where England claimed their only World Cup victory. Additionally, Wembley has hosted the finals of major European competitions, such as the 1963 and 1968 European Cup finals, and more recently, the Champions League finals in 2011 and 2013. Beyond soccer, Wembley has been a versatile venue, hosting concerts by some of the world’s biggest music acts, and annual regular-season NFL games, further cementing its status as a cultural icon.

Wembley’s capacity is another aspect that contributes to its grandeur. The stadium can accommodate 90,000 spectators, making it the largest stadium in the UK and the second largest in Europe. This immense capacity not only allows for a vibrant and electric atmosphere but also makes it an ideal location for events of global significance. The facilities ensure that every spectator enjoys a comfortable and memorable experience, whether they are seated in the front rows or the highest tiers.
